titleStmt.title: Letter, David Burford in Dixon Springs, Tenn., to J. C. Guild, 1835 Sept. 16

publicationStmt.publisher: The University of Tennessee Libraries Digital Initiatives

availability.p: The copyright interests in this collection remain with the creator. For more information, contact the Special Collections Library.

bibl.title: Letter, David Burford in Dixon Springs, Tenn., to J. C. Guild, 1835 Sept. 16

projectDesc.p: Machine-readable transcription created for the University of Tennessee Libraries Special Collections.

editorialDecl.p: Errors in transcription of the printed text not controlled.
Editorial tags limited to gap and unclear.
Catchwords and directional notes such as "turn page over" have been omitted.

revisionDesc.change: Approximate date of original transcription and transcriber.
Migrating from P4 to validated TEI P5.

div.p: Sir - I demand of you a copy of all and every letter which I have written you since Judge White has consented for his name to be reen for the Presidency of the U. States in which I have mentioned that subject.

My reason for demanding a copy must be obvious to you, it is to counteract erroneous statement made in relation to that letter by my opponent, and, as I have reason to beleive by your self during the late canvass. Respectfully
N.B. This will be handed you by my friend Wm Richard Hall through whom you can convey and any reply which you may choose to make me in writing. you may also show this to Maj. Trousdale
